Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours.

The Role

We are looking for a Sr. Computer Scientist who will be responsible for the design, development, testing, troubleshooting, measurement, optimization, and improvement of software, new products, and code libraries across platforms.


Partners with multi-functional experts (Product Management, Design, etc.) to determine customer focused solutions.
Uses standard methodologies, articulates ideas, & markets them across team and organization. Promotes a culture of continuous learning.
Leads application/framework/service design efforts, optimizing for quality, testability, and scale.
Uses appropriate & meaningful programming languages and technologies, writes code, tests & deploys to meet business requirements.
Be a technical leader with the ability and desire to mentor other members of the team.
Prototype new approaches and production solutions at scale.
Work with Data Scientists to implement strategies for cleaning and preparing data for analysis, to develop data imputation algorithms, and optimize performance of data retrieval and machine learning systems.


B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent engineering degree
5+ years of experience crafting and developing web or software applications
Proven expertise in Java, OOP Principles and Design Patterns
Proven expertise in crafting and developing scalable and resilient applications
Strong algorithm and logical skills
Experience with Big Data technologies like Hadoop, HBase, MapReduce, Spark, Kafka. Operational experience with these is a plus.
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and CI/CD pipeline is a plus
Clarity around ML fundamentals like Probability theory, Statistics, Bayesian Approach, Supervised, Unsupervised and Reinforcement learning, Linear Models, Decision trees, Neural Networks etc.
J2EE, XML, AWS Technologies, Web Services, REST, JSON, Casandra, MySQL, Spring Boot, Junit, TestNG, Spring
Familiarity with monitoring systems like New Relic, Prometheus, Splunk, Grafana etc is a plus
Ability to research and become proficient in new technologies
Unending curiosity, thoroughness, tenacity and focus on quickly crafting and building complex software systems with great quality to solve customer problems
Have a good sense of organization to set expectations and keep deliverables on a timeline, with the ability to document, communicate and justify all technology decisions and directions

Description:
The company
At Adore Me we take on seemingly impossible challenges. In 2011, we were founded to solve a single problem: help women buy bras online. It might seem like a simple task, but a bra is one of the most complex and personal garments in existence. Managing the design, procurement, logistics, and customer experience involved is an uphill climb, but one that built our company to take on increasingly greater challenges.
Adore Me grew into the first major online player in lingerie, as well as the first to introduce inclusive sizing in the category. We launched a wholly-owned logistics center, Adore Me Services, in 2017, the same year we became profitable (something very important to us). We've launched a pioneering try-at-home shopping service, a number of innovation-focused satellite brands, and most importantly, an affordable #sustainability model that is transforming our entire business to make sustainable clothing available to consumers of all shapes, sizes, and spending abilities.

Job_title: Software Engineer – Power and Performance Benchmarking
Description:
Ready to join the future of innovation at NXP?
The Microprocessors Software team in Bucharest is responsible for enabling the Linux BSP on NXP's i.MX family microprocessors. Our work focuses on the lower levels of the operating system such as the kernel, as well as delivering fully functional Yocto Linux images.
Power and performance benchmarking is a crucial part in the development process to ensure that operating systems meet the power and performance consumption standards when running on the i.MX family. Using different tools and automated processes which we continuously develop and maintain is key in delivering efficient power & performance statistics.
We are looking for people with operating systems & CPU architectures knowledge, proactive and eager to learn, design, automate and execute power & performance test cases for our Linux & Android BSP project, as well as in delivering data analysis.

Description:
We are looking to recruit a Principal DBA or SysAdmin to join the established Oracle Database Exadata and Cloud support team. The successful candidate will be located in Romania and have Romanian citizenship and/or citizenship of another European Union country. The team’s main responsibility is to troubleshoot highly complex technical issues related to the Oracle Exadata stack and within areas like Real Application Clusters, High Availability, Data Guard, Corruption, Backup and Recovery, RMAN, Performance, Memory Management, Parallel query, Query tuning, Storage, ASM, Security, Networking, Storage and Linux operating system. The Engineer should have good hands on experience on Linux, Unix and/or Solaris platforms . The selected candidates are expected to work in partnership with customers, other support engineers and developers to deliver a superior ownership experience to the customer. The selected candidate will have opportunities to become an Expert / Guru in Oracle Database, Exadata and Cloud technologies. The candidate will be widely regarded as a subject matter expert in their current role and will demonstrate the ability to resolve complex problems or identify acceptable workarounds. He/she should be able to perform their assigned duties with a great degree of independence requiring minimal direction. The Engineer is expected to be a key member of the technical problem solving as well as problem avoidance team, routinely sought after to address extremely complex, critical customer issues.

As a Principal Support Engineer, you will offer strategic technical support to assure the highest level of customer satisfaction. A primary focus is to create/utilize automated technology and instrumentation to diagnose, document, and resolve/avoid customer issues. You are expected to be an expert member of the technical problem solving/problem avoidance team, routinely sought after to address extremely complex, critical customer issues. Services may be frequently provided by on-site customer visits.

Description:
Join us on our journey to radically improve the way billions of parcels move through our cities.

The best way to get us there is city logistics. Electric vehicles, particularly light ones, are used in combination with urban hubs or brick-and-mortar stores to reduce CO2 emissions by 95%, lighten the traffic and pollution burden on our cities, and cut vehicle costs by half.
At Palmo, we are building the software layer for city logistics—a marketplace that will enable shippers (e.g. e-commerce retailers or national carriers) to connect to a single API and get millions of their parcels moved seamlessly through major cities, do so sustainably, and at a fraction of today's cost.

️ The technical challenge is immense. Vast numbers of retailers, fleets, vehicles, and warehouses need to be connected. Additionally, we have to orchestrate the efficient and automatic movement of thousands of parcels in real-time, using purpose-built optimisation algorithms and machine learning.

Currently, we are building the core technology called PalmoDMS and onboarding initial partners.

We are a small team of experienced builders and have offices in Berlin and Bucharest, though we are also open to outstanding remote profiles.
Having raised our first round of funding from top VCs & angel investors, we are now looking to build a world-class engineering team.
If you care about our mission, are deeply passionate about your work, and want to shape a high-growth startup from day 1, we’d like to talk.

Tasks

We are looking for an exceptional and experienced Full Stack Engineer.
You'll report directly to the CTO and have ownership and responsibility over key areas of our product and technology. As one of our first colleagues, you will be crucial in shaping Palmo’s success and culture. We are looking for a generalist who is excited at the prospect of mastering new technologies to solve business problems and will enjoy the thrills of fast-growing early-stage startups.

Your focus will be on building and maintaining our delivery management system, which requires secure, resilient, and real-time ingestion, consumption and processing of data from various sources and integrations. Frontend, backend, working directly with our vehicle routing algorithms and ML-based optimisation engine - you’ll get to touch it all.


Requirements


Benefits

Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide
Job title: Planning Engineer ,
Based at: Romania-Bucharest
Introduction
For almost 30 years, Alstom has been an innovative pioneer playing an important role in Romania’s transition towards a modern and sustainable railway transport. From state-of-the-art digital rail control, to infrastructure and electrification projects, along with metro trains and the long-term maintenance of the metro fleet in the country’s capital city Bucharest, Alstom is constantly making a difference in the mainline and urban rail transport in Romania.

Description:
Discover ING Bank
ING believes in a world where everyone has the right to grow and progress in their own way. We express this in our global tagline, “do your thing”. Perhaps more than in any other large company, we extend our belief in the power of autonomy to our own people. But there’s a catch. In return for great freedom, we expect people to do great things for our customers, our stakeholders, and ING at large.
To work here is to be surrounded by people who are energetic, ambitious, friendly and respectful: talented specialists who take the responsibility and autonomy to make great things happen. We stay curious, thrive on change, and seek new and better ways to make it happen. Active in Romania for more than 25 years, ING Bank pioneered and challenged the local banking industry. Technology and innovation are at the core of what we do, making our products relevant for our customers’ lives and businesses.

Description:
Description

The Senior Quality Engineer is an essential role in the software development life cycle and ensures only properly tested software is released to production. A flawless customer experience is our top priority and this role plays a major part in that company goal. By designing and executing properly prepared test cases (both manual and automated) and working closely together with the entire agile team, this goal is achievable. This position focuses on both the Agile team as well as the QE organization.

Part of your other responsibilities are:
Participates in all Agile ceremonies for Team;
Develops key quality metrics and reports to stakeholders in the organization
Writes general documentation regarding QE processes and tools
Identifies new tools or processes for adoption
Creates test strategies and plans for team and assists other teams when needed
Uses and modifies existing libraries / tools for automation testing
Understands complex problems, develops solutions and can communicate to both people inside and outside of their team
Works with various areas of the business, grasp their processes and learn how they work together
Reviews automated test runs, reports out on automated test execution and coverage statuses and maintains broken automated tests
Helps lead test automation effort, advocating for automation and contributes to framework design and suggests process improvements
Plans and executes tests to cover functional, integration, compatibility and regression needs and reports back findings to the Team
Requirements
writing automation, working with a framework, etc.;
APl/Integration test automation;
Working experience with JavaScript;
Working experience with Webdriver IO;
Sound understanding of testing methodologies and testing lifecycle including behaviour-driven testing and data-driven testing.
Experience working in agile scrum team
Good Team Player and excellent communication skills
Able to work independently and has a proactive attitude
Benefits
Private health subscription + hospitalization package
Private dental subscription
Gym subscription
Vouchers/bonuses for special events (birthday, Christmas, Easter, etc)
Meal vouchers of 30 RON/working day (maximum legal value)
Ability to work with a global company and immerse in a variety of international projects with different cultures within the IT industry
Access to cutting edge and state of the art technologies current with the everyday evolvement of technologies
Development opportunities with free access to over 3000+ training courses and peer to peer mentoring support

Description:
Provision, deploy, manage, and program networks with software-defined networking. In this centralized approach to network management, the underlying network infrastructure is abstracted from applications.
Location: Romania/Bulgaria/Serbia/Moldavia/Hungary/Ukraine
General description
Provision, deploy, manage, and program networks with software-defined networking. In this centralized approach to network management, the underlying network infrastructure is abstracted from applications. Software Defined Networks (SDN) provides choice in automation and programmability across data centers SD-LAN, campuses, and wide-area networks SD-WAN.
The role of SDN in cloud computing lets users respond quickly to changes. SDN management makes network configuration more efficient and improves network performance and monitoring. Candidate will be responsible to design new solution to fulfill customer requirements and to execute functionality testing and implementation of the developed solution. The role includes consultancy with operational teams, analysis of customer demands, conversion of the requirements into a technical specification.

Description

We are looking for a QA Automation Engineer to work as part of a cross functional Agile - Scrum team creating and performing both manual, functional and automated testing activities.

As part of this team, our colleagues are performing both types of testing, initially manual testing as the project team builds and expands the automated test suite.

Part of your other responsibilities are:
Work as part of a cross functional Agile scrum team creating and performing both manual functional and automated testing activities. You will be flexible enough to perform both types of testing initially as the project team builds and expands the automated test suite.
Design manual functional and/or automated Test scripts in line with requirements and perform hands on Test Execution
Perform Regression Testing and E2E testing
Manage defects in JIRA Xray from logging to closure
Remote working with monthly travel to Gdansk Poland required to align with the scrum team
Requirements
4 to 8 years of experience in a similar role
Strong technical skills in Java, TestNG, and Cucumber BDD and able to develop and execute automation scripts/frameworks using these technologies
Experience with testing cloud-based solutions in a microservices environment
Experience with API testing, E2E Testing, and integration testing over IBM MQ
Experience with the JIRA Xray tool for managing Test Scripts, Test Execution cycles, and Defects
Sound understanding of testing methodologies and testing lifecycle including behavior-driven testing and data-driven testing.
Experience maintaining testing frameworks for high volume, low latency systems
Experience working in Agile scrum teams
Good Team Player with excellent communication skills
Able to work independently and has a proactive attitude


Technical skills and experience with Selenium, Kafka, JSON, XML are beneficial
Previous working experience in banking and financial services clients
Understanding of AWS cloud

Private health subscription + hospitalization package
Private dental subscription
Bookster

Vouchers/bonuses for special events (birthday, Christmas, Easter, etc)

Access to cutting edge and state of the art technologies current with the everyday evolvement of technologies

Description:

The Senior QA Analyst is a member of the Agile Team responsible for testing software developed for Capital Markets Equities Products; they apply business requirements and knowledge of software testing lifecycles to guide the testing of complex software products or customer solutions. The Senior QA Analyst contributes through their technical expertise and talent development. They work as a part of a Scrum team utilizing Continuous Integration and Behaviour Driven Development and adopting DevOps practices.

Study requirement specifications and raise clarifications to business analysts and customers.
Able to document processes and share knowledge (helping to build up the knowledge in LSEG that we are currently dependent on EP for)

Description:
The Role
As LucaNet begin our exciting transformation to a cloud native SaaS platform, we are opening a Technology Centre of Excellence in Romania to drive the evolution of our Corporate Performance Management product and cement our place as a leader in this market.

You will be responsible for ensuring the quality of our company's software products by designing, developing, and executing comprehensive test plans and cases. You will be part of our first cohort of QA hires in Bucharest who will work closely with our existing QA team in Berlin primarily focussed on the transformation to our new cloud platform.

This role is suited to an ambitious Senior QA who wants to further develop their testing skills whilst helping us transform the future of LucaNet and corporate performance management software.

Description:
Project Description
Our client is the market leading producer of Integrated Circuits Lithography and Metrology machines, based in the Netherlands.
Project scope is the development and maintenance of high volume manufacturing algorithms for lithography processes.

Our client's Applications products are critical elements in the semiconductor manufacturing process. These products are largely software driven. Wafer Fab Applications (WFA) is the part of the Application products responsible for developing and delivering products that improve the performance of the clients' scanners by translating large amounts of performance data into scanner correction profiles.


As part of the services development team, help safeguard quality of delivered software by improving test approach and speeding up qualification of team deliverables.
You will be part of a team with 3-6 developers, a Scrum Master, Product Owner and functional domain expert. Your team will work together with many other teams on building reliable solutions for our customers using a SAFe-Agile approach.

Description:
This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Quality Assurance test analyst with a background in financial software/markets/instruments.
Working within the UnaVista team, part of a leading UK investment and financial services company, you will be responsible for the QA of regulatory, post trade, reconciliation and data solutions.
To be successful in this job, you should have previous software testing experience and a confirmed software delivery background preferably within some of the following areas:
Regulatory reporting – e.g. MiFIR, EMIR (and ideally knowledge of regulations from ESMA, FCA and other Regulators and Venues)
Post trade services – e.g. trade confirmations, clearing
Matching and reconciliation – Trade Repository / Regulator
Due to the nature of the UnaVista Platform and Solutions, technical knowledge and experience will expedite your acclimatization to this position.

Description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.
This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.
Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.

Description

We are looking for a Performance Engineer to work as part of a cross functional Agile - Scrum team creating and performing non-functional testing to assure performance, scalability, resilience, and operational stability of a cloud-based solution.

Develop non-functional test scrips in line with NFRs and perform hands on Test Execution
Manage defects in JIRA Xray from logging to closure
Remote working with monthly travel to Gdansk Poland required to align with the scrum team

2 to 5 years of experience on performance testing
Experienced in using JMeter testing tool for all types of performance testing
Experience with other non-functional test types such as Load, Stress, Scalability and Endurance tests
Experience with testing cloud-based solutions in a microservices environment
Experience with non-functional testing of APIs and/or Integrations over IBM MQ
Experience with JIRA Xray tool for managing Test Scripts, Test Execution cycles and Defects
Sound understanding of testing methodologies and testing lifecycle including behaviour-driven testing and data-driven testing.
Collaborate with Performance Monitoring team to profile applications, assisting in identifying tools to be used for monitoring and determining scope of monitoring
Create roles/storyboards to be used in application performance testing and monitoring
Ability to understand application performance key performance indicators (KPIs)
Experience maintaining testing frameworks for high volume, low latency systems
Experience working in agile scrum team
Good Team Player and excellent communication skills
Able to work independently and has a proactive attitude


Technical skills and experience with Kafka, JSON, XML are beneficial
Previous working experience in banking and financial services clients
Understanding of AWS cloud

Private health subscription + hospitalization package
Private dental subscription
Gym subscription
Bookster
Vouchers/bonuses for special events (birthday, Christmas, Easter, etc)
Meal vouchers of 30 RON/working day (maximum legal value)

Job_title: Senior Embedded C++ Software Development Engineer
Description:
Summary:
VIAVI (NASDAQ: VIAV) has a 90+ year history of technical innovations that have evolved to keep pace and address our customer’s most pressing business issues. We make equipment, software, and systems that help to plan, deploy, certify, monitor, and optimize all kinds of networks - like those for mobile phones, service providers, large businesses and data centers.
VIAVI is also a leader in high performance thin film optical coatings and engineered diffusers, providing light management solutions to anti-counterfeiting, consumer electronics, automotive, defence and instrumentation markets.
We are the people behind the products that help keep the world connected – at home, school, work, at play, and everywhere in between. VIAVI employees are fierce about supporting customer success and we welcome people who bring their best every day to the company - to question, to collaborate and to push for solutions that will delight our customers.

Description:
Responsibilities
 Design, develop, construct, install, test and maintaining the complete data management & processing systems
 Contribute to the continuous optimization of the Big Data Platform and related infrastructure, network, database, and middleware capabilities to support and enable the development and operations of Data modules and solutions.
 Discover opportunities for data acquisitions and explore new ways of using existing data.
 Contribute to improving data quality, reliability & efficiency of the whole system.
 Create data models to reduce system complexity and hence increase efficiency & reduce cost.
 Administer the monitoring, maintaining, and supporting the operational capacity, availability, and performance of the Big Data Platform solutions against SLAs from a level two and level three support perspective
 Contribute in technical discussions with Teradata Platform service providers (on-/ off-prem) to understand forecast and right- sizing impacts for short-, mid- and long-term capacity and performance requirements, iterating regularly.

Description:
Project Description
Founded in 1984, Our Client is the world's leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or chips. Client has its R&D and manufacturing operations in Connecticut. Luxoft is currently searching to augment the Development & Engineering Department with talented software engineer to design and implement embedded software for systems among the highest precision ever produced in the world.

The project seeking a new colleague is in charge with the software infrastructure and applications controlling the lithography process. Together with several other teams we create the software being used by all major players in the computer chips manufacturing industry.
The project consists of 4 scrum teams, some distributed and some co-located, owning software tools and applications in different technologies (Qt and C++, Python and bash, etc.).

Description:
Project Description
Offer management are all the capabilities an airline needs to define, manage and retail offers for airline content, such as flights and ancillaries, as well as third-party content. The offer management system is designed to act as a single source of truth for both airline channels (direct channel APIs and NDC) and for data and analytics
The core component of the Wolverine Offer Management System is Retail Mixer. It is an orchestration application providing 3 distinct capabilities:
Sourcing airline content (air, seat, ancillary) and third-party content (insurance, car, hotel) from any vendor or application
Creating and managing source-agnostic offers for each type of content in a way that its fully abstracted from the source
Distributing those offers on direct channels via JSON APIs or to indirect channels via NDC APIs
Retail Mixer is core component of Dakota in the Airline IT space, as well as in future New Marketplace use cases.

Description:
As a C++ Software Engineer at Ascom, you will be joining our R&D team to improve and innovate our communication solutions for healthcare, industry, security and retail. In this role you will solve complex problems for our customers by creating new or adapting existing software products.
You will develop an understanding of the unique goals of projects and develop and maintain software to broaden Ascom’s product offerings. You will work as part of a cross functional team within a multinational environment, closely collaborating with the wider R&D Team.
Our office is based in Cluj-Napoca, Ascom provides the opportunity for hybrid or fully remote working (candidates must be based in Romania)

Description:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
Extensive professional experience in Embedded Software Development
Proficiency in Computer Science fundamentals such as; object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Extensive embedded development experience in C / C++
Experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.

At Ring we have a unique possibility to innovate and see how the results of our work improve the lives of millions of people and make neighborhoods safer. You will be part of a team committed to pushing the frontier of computer vision and machine learning technology to deliver the best experience for our neighbors. This is a great opportunity for you to innovate in this space by developing highly optimized algorithms that will work on scale. You will collaborate with different Amazon teams to make informed decisions on the best practices in machine learning to build highly-optimized integrated hardware and software platforms. Key job responsibilities At Ring, we are committed to making home and neighborhood security accessible and effective for everyone – while working hard to bring communities together. As a skilled Embedded Software Development Engineer, you will drive engineering and business decisions, leveraging technology frameworks, optimization techniques and high availability services. In this role, you will lead the design of features and initiatives across the organization. Your main focus will be on firmware development of complex features for upcoming Ring battery-powered devices, on several Linux and/or RTOS based SOCs. You may also work on new sensors and algorithms evaluation and specific tools development as needed. You are passionate about IoT, responsive and flexible. The successful candidate will investigate, prototype, and deliver high-quality software, working in a dynamic, team-focused Agile/Scrum environment.

Job_title: Technical Support Engineer with German (SCCM & Intune)
Description:
Company Description

Part of the Ratiodata Group, Accesa is a leading technology company headquartered in Cluj-Napoca, with offices in Oradea and Munich. Over the past 18 years, the company has been establishing itself as an employer of choice for IT professionals who are passionate about problem-solving through technology and want to have a measurable impact through their work.
A trusted partner for major brands in Retail, Consumer Goods, Manufacturing, and Automotive, Accesa helps businesses embrace flexibility, adaptability, and evolution within their digital journey, through a large spectrum of tailored IT services, leveraging mainstream, niche, as well as legacy technologies.
Its sister-company RaRo delivers complex digital evolution solutions for highly regulated industries like Insurance and Banking and, together, the two companies cover the complete digital evolution journey of their customers, from hardware to software and managed services solutions.

Description:
Company Description

The Udder Group exist to provide plain-speaking advice based on research, data and hands-on experience leading HR, Talent & Recruitment teams to employers and HR technology firms across the UK and beyond.
Our Implementation and Automation practice helps companies deliver the highest value from their technology investments, and harness the power of automation to reduce cost, improve employee experience and significantly boost the job quality of HR professionals.

Job Description

If there's something inefficient in the HR processes neighbourhood, who're we gonna call? You. Your role at Udder will be to seek out opportunities to integrate HR tech platforms with each other, automate and enhance processes using automation tools (like Zapier, merge.dev, Workato, Jitterbit, etc.), and design and build elegant solutions.

You're likely to be or become an expert in APIs, PostMan, webhooks and will be using low or no-code tools to build often-complex integration capabilities. You will be our go-to person to evaluate new platforms as part of clients' tech stacks from an integration capability perspective, test API functionality, build and evolve pre-built integrations in our own Zapier library, and find ways to make Recruitment, HR Management and Learning & Development ever more efficient for our forward-thinking clients.

Finally, you will become lead solution engineer for our Tech by Udder business, building products which plug and play well with our clients' existing technology, and which provide simple, fast and effective solutions to improve their HR processes. These will include background screening, offer management, internal mobility and much much more.

Job_title: Software Engineer – Power and Performance Benchmarking
Description:
Ready to join the future of innovation at NXP?
The Microprocessors Software team in Bucharest is responsible for enabling the Linux BSP on NXP's i.MX family microprocessors. Our work focuses on the lower levels of the operating system such as the kernel, as well as delivering fully functional Yocto Linux images.
Power and performance benchmarking is a crucial part in the development process to ensure that operating systems meet the power and performance consumption standards when running on the i.MX family. Using different tools and automated processes which we continuously develop and maintain is key in delivering efficient power & performance statistics.
We are looking for people with operating systems & CPU architectures knowledge, proactive and eager to learn, design, automate and execute power & performance test cases for our Linux & Android BSP project, as well as in delivering data analysis.

Who are Tide:
At Tide, we're on a mission to save businesses time and money. We're the leading provider of UK SME business accounts and one of the fastest-growing FinTechs in the UK. Tide is about doing what you love. We're looking for someone to join us on our exciting scale up journey and be a part of something special. Description:
Company Summary
Veridium is a leading provider of end-to-end biometric authentication solutions for enterprises deploying biometrics as part of their access and identity management security strategies. Powered by an unmatched knowledge of biometrics R&D, Veridium solutions increase convenience and security, reduce fraud, and cut costs associated with passwords and traditional multi-factor authentication. We are looking for highly motivated, forward-thinking talent to add to our growing team.
*
Job Overview*
It is in our DNA to continuously learn and try to adopt the latest technologies and architecture styles. In such a context, you will have the chance to own the development of features and propose new improvements and ideas which can be integrated into the platform.
It is in our daily routine to have pair programming sessions to accelerate the development effort while still sharing the knowledge with other team members. While working in an Agile environment we highly appreciate detailed design documents and prototypes (when needed) to take the correct decision for complex and risky features. We always prefer working code instead of never-ending documents.

Description:
We are looking to recruit a Principal DBA or SysAdmin to join the established Oracle Database Exadata and Cloud support team. The successful candidate will be located in Romania and have Romanian citizenship and/or citizenship of another European Union country. The team’s main responsibility is to troubleshoot highly complex technical issues related to the Oracle Exadata stack and within areas like Real Application Clusters, High Availability, Data Guard, Corruption, Backup and Recovery, RMAN, Performance, Memory Management, Parallel query, Query tuning, Storage, ASM, Security, Networking, Storage and Linux operating system. The Engineer should have good hands on experience on Linux, Unix and/or Solaris platforms . The selected candidates are expected to work in partnership with customers, other support engineers and developers to deliver a superior ownership experience to the customer. The selected candidate will have opportunities to become an Expert / Guru in Oracle Database, Exadata and Cloud technologies. The candidate will be widely regarded as a subject matter expert in their current role and will demonstrate the ability to resolve complex problems or identify acceptable workarounds. He/she should be able to perform their assigned duties with a great degree of independence requiring minimal direction. The Engineer is expected to be a key member of the technical problem solving as well as problem avoidance team, routinely sought after to address extremely complex, critical customer issues.

As a Principal Support Engineer, you will offer strategic technical support to assure the highest level of customer satisfaction. A primary focus is to create/utilize automated technology and instrumentation to diagnose, document, and resolve/avoid customer issues. You are expected to be an expert member of the technical problem solving/problem avoidance team, routinely sought after to address extremely complex, critical customer issues. Services may be frequently provided by on-site customer visits.

Description:
LSEG delivers truly world-changing insight based on rich content sources. This is a dominant playing field to provide intelligent fund performance data that helps financial market participants find more profitable investment opportunities.
The LSEG Lipper provides global, independent fund performance data in a precise, granular fund classification system, and includes mutual funds, closed-end funds (CEFs), exchange-traded funds (ETFs), hedge funds, domestic retirement funds, pension funds, and insurance products.
The LSEG Lipper, is looking for Senior PL/SQL developer who will work with upper management, architecture, development, and quality assurance teams to define software requirements and take the lead on technical projects using his excellent organization and problem-solving skills. Strong hands-on experience in development and agile methodologies is critical. Your goal will be to enhance and develop high-quality software that is aligned with user needs and business requirements.
If you are interested in leading the development of critical, large-scale, high performance distributed systems that set standards for financial markets, we want you on our team.

Description:
Company Description

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Deaf of Hard of Hearing Black, Hispanic, Asian, Military Veterans, the Elderly, the LGBTQ, and Justice Impacted individuals. If you identify with any of the following communities do not hesitate to register.

Company Name: FIS Global

Job Description

Full time
Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
Bachelor's Degree
1 - 5%

Summary
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

Description:
Join us on our journey to radically improve the way billions of parcels move through our cities.

The best way to get us there is city logistics. Electric vehicles, particularly light ones, are used in combination with urban hubs or brick-and-mortar stores to reduce CO2 emissions by 95%, lighten the traffic and pollution burden on our cities, and cut vehicle costs by half.
At Palmo, we are building the software layer for city logistics—a marketplace that will enable shippers (e.g. e-commerce retailers or national carriers) to connect to a single API and get millions of their parcels moved seamlessly through major cities, do so sustainably, and at a fraction of today's cost.

️ The technical challenge is immense. Vast numbers of retailers, fleets, vehicles, and warehouses need to be connected. Additionally, we have to orchestrate the efficient and automatic movement of thousands of parcels in real-time, using purpose-built optimisation algorithms and machine learning.

Currently, we are building the core technology called PalmoDMS and onboarding initial partners.

We are a small team of experienced builders and have offices in Berlin and Bucharest, though we are also open to outstanding remote profiles.
Having raised our first round of funding from top VCs & angel investors, we are now looking to build a world-class engineering team.
If you care about our mission, are deeply passionate about your work, and want to shape a high-growth startup from day 1, we’d like to talk.

Tasks

We are looking for an exceptional and experienced Full Stack Engineer.
You'll report directly to the CTO and have ownership and responsibility over key areas of our product and technology. As one of our first colleagues, you will be crucial in shaping Palmo’s success and culture. We are looking for a generalist who is excited at the prospect of mastering new technologies to solve business problems and will enjoy the thrills of fast-growing early-stage startups.

Your focus will be on building and maintaining our delivery management system, which requires secure, resilient, and real-time ingestion, consumption and processing of data from various sources and integrations. Frontend, backend, working directly with our vehicle routing algorithms and ML-based optimisation engine - you’ll get to touch it all.


Requirements

Description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.
This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.
Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.

Description:
We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than 75 000 people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact.
Job title: Testing & Commssioning Engineer
Based at: Brasov / Sighisoara
Introduction
Alstom in Romania has been present for over 20 years employing today around 1100 people. Alstom, registered major success in infrastructure, signaling and also services. The long term service agreement for the maintenance of the rolling stock of Metrorex is a major reference and shows the expertise of Alstom in this field. Alstom will continue to grow his business in Romania proposing further services for the local market and export, creating regional hub in Services and Signaling.
The Brasov Sighisoara Project is part of the program of rehabilitation of the line “Brasov-Sighisoara” that is part of the European Corridor IV. The purpose of the project is to increase the running speed from 120 km/h to 160 km/h. The increase of the running speed requires the implementation of “the signalling code with four indications on BLA distances” and of “the signalling system with multi-step speed (MSS) in stations”. The home signals and the departure signals in each station will be relocated, because of the railway track systematization works. The existing train speed control and automatic stopping system (INDUSI) will be maintained for the trains running at speeds up to 120km/h that are not equipped with on-board ETCS unit (OBU). At “green” and “Blinking green” indications, the 500 Hz and 1000/2000 Hz indicators will be passive. For the national and international trains running at speeds up to 160km/h, and equipped with on-board ETCS unit (OBU), the ETCS Level 2 system with GSM-R will be implemented. This system transmits the movement authorization, the speed profile, etc, by GSM-R, to the on-board ETCS unit that controls the train speed.

Description:
Do you like to solve technical problems? Are you interested in data processing and how statistical concepts boil down to the behavior of individual ICs? Infineon Technologies Romania is looking for a Product Engineer to analyze large sets of electrical data, with the goal of optimizing the production testing of complex automotive integrated power supplies.
At Infineon, all automotive ICs have their electrical parameters measured in production before being sold to our customers.

Before the production release of a new IC, statistically relevant batches of devices are tested in a production-like setup, evaluating device’s readiness for mass manufacturing.

Once the product is released, high volumes of electrical data are analyzed in order to improve the production yield without any compromise on quality.
It is the Product Engineer’s responsibility to correlate the statistical behavior of the measured electrical parameters to Front-End and Back-End technology parameters, testing HW and SW and ultimately to the functionality of the IC down to transistor level.

In this role, the PRE Engineer interacts with numerous skills from IC designers, to test programmers, verification engineers, production engineers and technology specialists spread across the globe.

In your new role, you will be responsible for:

Description:
Who are we?
At Vertiv, we build products that keep critical technologies running 24/7. We are proud we were the first to protect mainframes with precision cooling systems. We were the first to introduce an integrated enclosure system to distributed networks. We help some of the largest names in the industry bring new capacity online faster and at a lower cost when search and social media increased demand for storage and computing.
Vertiv brings together hardware, software, analytics, and ongoing services to ensure its customers' vital applications run continuously, perform optimally, and grow with their business needs.
As a Sales Support you will be responsible for supporting the DACH region sales activities and contribute to smoothing and improving the sales process. The main responsibilities of this role are sales support, creating quotes using the Vertiv configurator (C1), credit checking, CRM (Oracle) management, preparing customer PO's for order processing, and sales performance reporting.

Description:
Job Description Summary
Join us at GE Digital Grid Software to be part of the team leading the digital transformation of the energy market. As the world’s energy sector moves away from fossil fuels toward renewable energy sources, this transformation will be key to making power-generating assets more efficient and the electric grid more secure and resilient. Our Geospatial products will play a critical role, by supporting the design, modelling and maintenance of electric, gas and telecommunications networks.
You will be a part of our Asset Management Engineering team, an Agile organization with a flexible working environment, where we are constantly looking to evolve our products, and the processes and technologies we use. Our current focus is on leveraging our long history of building client-server solutions, supported by our well-established geospatial experience, to develop innovative products, driven through microservices architecture and delivered via the Cloud. We are seeking to hire people who are passionate about technology, enjoy solving challenging problems and value the positive impact their work makes to our customers. As we significantly grow our current team, your technical expertise will enable us to implement this transformation.
You will be the senior engineering leader for a small team focused on the technologies and capabilities that enable build and release pipelines to be successful. Your team will collaborate with a number of Product Engineering teams and through this you will be involved at every stage of product development, from setting up research projects through to problem solving production issues for customers.

Your team is responsible for the infrastructure, tools and processes that enables development teams to be productive and deliver on their commitments. You are responsible for making your team a success.
Collaborating with around ten product and project teams you will develop the strategy and roadmap required for your team to deliver on the business goals. You will inspire and develop your team as you lead them in breaking down your vision into a deliverable plan and executing on that plan in sprintly increments.
Be in no doubt, this is a technical role and you should expect people from within and beyond your team to seek you out for your knowledge and skills with tools like Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes and your ability to give clear guidance on how best to apply them to the challenge at hand.
Your experience deploying cloud solutions will be essential to influence teams on how our products should be developed, deployed and maintained. Challenges will range from cloud native development deploying to AWS/Azure through to modernizing established products to be deployed and managed through Kubernetes.
Your team is responsible for the frameworks and infrastructure that support everything the development teams do; when they fail they will look to you. You will be calm when those around you are not. You will have data, know your system and be able to quickly put into action a plan to recover and keep everyone informed.
You will never be quite satisfied with your achievements, always seeing something else that could be better and challenging the status quo, you will instil a culture of innovation and the DevOps team will be a hub of change for itself and the teams around it.
You will be a thought leader in your field and will want to get your message out and as such you will influence both the current practices and future direction across GE. As part of this you would be an active influencer of the “Delivery Transformation Team” which is our global DevOps group rolling out best practices across a wide organisation.
